reviews.title: Warm Welcome, Bags of character BUT
Charming and hospitable
reviews.text: We arrived at this beautiful, charming historic hotel to a warm welcome and extremely considerate and helpful assistance from all at Hotel Diderot. My husband had developed a problem with his knee several days earlier, and was on crutches, so an alternate room was organised on the first floor. This meant that he did not have to use the stairs as there is street level access at the back of the hotel. They also organised an appointment with a doctor, supplied cups of tea and coffee for us, and were most solicitous for his welfare. We would love to return and spend time exploring Chinon when he is able to walk around, and also enjoy again the excellent hospitality of Francoise, Laurent and Martine. Thank you all for making our stay so much easier - it is not easy travelling when one of the party is incapacitated.
We spent one night at the Hotel Diderot as we traveled from Bordeaux to Paris. What a gem. The people there could not have been nicer and their English was very good.
reviews.title: Incredible Stay!

reviews.text: This is the prototypical country in with a beautiful courtyard in front. They have parking for 12 cars in the courtyard, with additional parking nearby.
reviews.title: A real gem
Good value
reviews.text: Our room for three was huge and well appointed. The old wooden floors were a little creaky, but added character. The room was clean and the bathroom well equipped. We made friends with the house cat, who ended up visiting us in our room!

reviews.title: Wow,,,what a find!
reviews.text: Chinon is a fairly sleepy town. There are about a dozen restaurant choices, most fairly expensive. Of course, being in the Loire valley, the are many beautiful chateaus and castles with and hours drive.

The hotel is a small traditional family run hotel in a lovely old beamed house around a courtyard. The family are extremely friendly and helpful, and the building itself has real character. Breakfasts feature their own excellent jams. The rooms are not large, but the welcome and the character make the visit. We stayed for 5 nights (4 adults) in February - an excellent visit.
reviews.title: Excellent character hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent just one night at the Hotel Diderot during our trip through the Loire Valley, but it was a memorable stay. Our hosts were exceptionally polite and friendly, making us feel very welcome. The breakfast was wonderful- my favorite B&B breakfast in France. We had one of the lower priced rooms, which didn't offer as elegant a decor as some pictured on the website, but it was clean, spacious and very comfortable. The public areas and exterior of the building are very pretty and there is a lovely garden off the dining room. I would recommend this B&B to anyone. It's an especially good deal for the price.
reviews.title: Charming hosts and a great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a couple of days as a part of our honeymoon in Chinon and I picked the Hotel Diderot based on the overall excellent reviews. We were not disappointed at all. The staff was as charming as the hotel itself. Our room was tucked away, beautifully furnished and very quiet. The bed was very comfortable, especially nice after a full day of sightseeing. You really want to make sure you take breakfast in the morning as the huge assortment of homemade preserves was excellent. This is a place I would happily stay at again if I were

Warm and wonderful
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel with great ambience. Perfect, accommodating (beyond expectations) hosts. Breakfast (with wonderful homemade jams) started each day on the right note and we looked forward to returning to our cozy room after driving to neighboring chateaux.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at Hotel Diderot, in a room in the older part of the hotel. We thought Diderot was fantastic - a very friendly welcome, a pretty room with a nice view of the courtyard below, an excellent breakfast (all those home-made jams!), a glass of local wine on the terrace before going out for dinner, even a friendly cat to meet. There's no lift in the old building which will limit access for some people, but this immaculately kept hotel was ideal for us.
reviews.title: A beautiful family-run hotel
What a great staff and team
reviews.text: We found the Hotel in the Rick Steves guide book. I was raised in Europe and the staff was so helpful in finding my old house ( Chateau D'Perrier)> The hotel is delightful and the staff very friendly and helpful in all ways they could. Our weather was beautiful and free time was spent in the courtyard. All the sites are within easy walking distance. Would highly reccomend. Francoise is a delight as are her brother and sister. The jams are the greatest. Price is very reasonable, and email correspondance is quick and precise.
For the price, value, staff and location you cannot beat this hotel. Very helpful in every aspect of our stay and a short walk to all of Chinon. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Gem Hotel in Chinon

description: Buil in the 15th century in the heart of Chinon and refurbished in the 18th century this dwelling opens a new page in the art of fine living in the Loire Valley, land of chateaux and vineyards.23 rooms made for restful nights. Breakfast served depending on the season, in the graden under the banana trees or before the lavish 15th century fireplace.
